perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Initial Term. This Agreement will become effective as of the Effective Date and, unless sooner terminated pursuant to Sections 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion] or 10.2  [Termination for Breach], shall remain effective for two (2) years from and after the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). This agreement shall automatically renew for additional successive terms of twelve (12) months each at the end of the Initial Term ("Renewal Terms"), unless either party notifies the other in writing at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the Initial Term. As used in this agreement, "Term" shall mean the Initial Term and the Renewal Terms, if any.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Initial Term. This Agreement will become effective as of the Effective Date and, unless sooner terminated pursuant to Sections 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion] or 10.2  [Termination for Breach], shall remain effective for two (2) years from and after the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). This agreement may or may not be renewed for additional successive terms of twelve (12) months each at the end of the Initial Term ("Renewal Terms"), with no notification required from either party. As used in this agreement, "Term" shall mean the Initial Term and the Renewal Terms, if any.
perturbation.explanation: Section 10.1 initially specifies that the contract automatically renews unless notification is given. The modified version introduces uncertainty and contradicts this by stating renewal is optional and requires no notification, making it unclear if the contract continues after the initial term.

perturbation.original_text: 9.3 Usage. All uses by one party of the other party's Marks shall be in accordance with such quality control standards as the licensing party may promulgate from time to time and each party agrees to refrain from all uses of the other party's Marks to which the other party objects. All promotional literature and other materials prepared by a party in connection with its promotional obligations hereunder shall bear appropriate copyright and/or trademark notices as prescribed by the other party, if the other party's content or branding is included therein. Each party agrees that it will not use, register or attempt to register in any jurisdiction, or otherwise appropriate or adopt any name, mark or logo that is confusingly similar to the other party's Marks. At no time during the term of the Agreement or thereafter shall eDiets attack, challenge or file any application with respect to any Women.com Mark. At no time during the term of the Agreement or thereafter shall Women.com attack, challenge or file any application with respect to any eDiets Mark.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.3 Usage. All uses by one party of the other party's Marks should adhere to basic standards of usage, however, one party might or might not object for the usage of other party's mark. All promotional literature and other materials prepared by a party in connection with its promotional obligations hereunder may or may not bear appropriate copyright and/or trademark notices as prescribed by the other party, if the other party's content or branding is included therein. Each party can use, register or attempt to register in any jurisdiction, or otherwise appropriate or adopt any name, mark or logo that is confusingly similar to the other party's Marks. At any time during the term of the Agreement or thereafter eDiets may attack, challenge or file any application with respect to any Women.com Mark. At any time during the term of the Agreement or thereafter shall Women.com attack, challenge or file any application with respect to any eDiets Mark.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates adherence to quality control and prohibits trademark challenges. The modified text contradicts this by making quality control optional and permitting trademark challenges, creating uncertainty regarding trademark usage and protection.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 eDiets Content. Nothing in this Agreement shall effect a transfer of ownership in the eDiets Content from eDiets to Women.com, and eDiets shall retain all rights of copyright, trademark or other intellectual property rights in such eDiets Content that it possessed prior to providing such eDiets Content to Women.com, subject only to the licenses expressly granted by eDiets to Women.com by this Agreement. eDiets retains all rights with respect to eDiets Content that are not specifically granted to Women.com herein. Women.com acknowledges that eDiets owns all right, title and interest in and to the eDiets Content, and Women.com shall not now or in the future contest the validity of the eDiets' ownership rights in and to the eDiets Content. eDiets agrees to periodically include mention of Women.com, including a link to the Women.com Site if desired by eDiets, within the eDiets Newsletter (the "Mention"). eDiets shall determine in its sole discretion the placement, frequency and timing of such Mention, provided that eDiets submits each Mention to Women.com for approval and secures such approval prior to publication or distribution of such Mention.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 eDiets Content. This Agreement may effect a transfer of ownership in the eDiets Content from eDiets to Women.com, and eDiets might or might not retain all rights of copyright, trademark or other intellectual property rights in such eDiets Content that it possessed prior to providing such eDiets Content to Women.com. eDiets does not retain all rights with respect to eDiets Content that are not specifically granted to Women.com herein. Women.com might or might not acknowledge that eDiets owns all right, title and interest in and to the eDiets Content, and Women.com may or may not in the future contest the validity of the eDiets' ownership rights in and to the eDiets Content. eDiets doesn't have to agree to periodically include mention of Women.com, including a link to the Women.com Site if desired by eDiets, within the eDiets Newsletter (the "Mention"). eDiets cannot determine in its sole discretion the placement, frequency and timing of such Mention, and eDiets might not need to submit each Mention to Women.com for approval and secures such approval prior to publication or distribution of such Mention.
perturbation.explanation: The original text firmly establishes eDiets' ownership of its content and control over mentions of Women.com. The modified version creates a contradiction by suggesting a possible transfer of ownership, questioning eDiets' retention of rights, and removing their control over newsletter mentions, thus generating uncertainty about content ownership and promotional responsibilities.
